db:abstract.db:para: How to install Qt for Windows CE. .

db:article.db:para: Qt for Windows CE has some requirements that are given in more detail in the Qt for Windows CE Requirements document.

db:section.db:title: Step 1: Install the License File (Commercial Editions Only)
db:section.db:para: Uncompress the files to the directory where you want to build; e.g., C:\Qt\%VERSION%.

db:note.db:para: The install path must not contain any spaces.

db:section.db:title: Step 2: Set the Environment Variables
db:section.db:para: In order to build and use Qt, the PATH environment variable needs to be extended:
Make sure the environment variables for your compiler are set. Or simply use the "Visual Studio Command Prompt" from the Start menu.

db:section.db:title: Step 3: Configure Qt
db:section.db:para: To configure Qt, for a custom SDK, type the following:
If you want to configure Qt for another platform or with other options, type configure -help to get a list of all available options. See the README file for the list of supported platforms.

db:note.db:para: The configure option -qtlibinfix cannot take a version number as an argument. For example: -qtlibinfix 5.6.0 should be specified as -qtlibinfix QtCore5.6.0.dll.

db:para.db:emphasis: That's all. Qt is now installed.

db:section.db:title: Qt Examples
db:section.db:para: To get started with Qt, you can check out the examples found in the examples directory of your Qt installation. The documentation can be found in doc\html.

db:note.db:para: If you reconfigure Qt for a different platform, make sure you start with a new clean console to get rid of the platform dependent include directories.

db:section.db:para: The links below provide further information for using Qt:
You might also want to try the following Windows CE specific links:

db:para.db:link: Windows CE - Introduction to using Qt
Windows CE - Working with Custom SDKs

db:section.db:para: We hope you will enjoy using Qt. Good luck!
